awd_titl_txt: An Efficient Linear Language for Parallel Symbolic          Processing
awd_abstract_narration: Next-generation intelligent systems and robots will require                the power of parallel computer, yet most novel parallel languages               are geared primarily for numerical calculation--e.g., signal                    processing--in which the data values are elementary numerical                   samples.  These models of computation fail miserably for                        calculations involving the highly-structured symbolic data required             for artificial intelligence application.  A "linear" language                   provides an elegant and intuitive "mechanical" model of parallel                computation in which structured values are transmitted as simply as             elementary values.  These "linear" data structures retain the                   ability to transmit highly structured information, yet avoid the                problems of aliasing and sharing.  The efficiency of existing                   linear language promising new implementation techniques.                        In Phase I, we will investigate the ability of our novel                        implementation approach to provide most of the efficiency of                    nonlinear shared data structures while preserving the elegant                   linear data model.  If successful, our Phase II implementation of               a parallel linear language will provide efficient execution,                    together with an elegant and intuitive programming model.  This                 combination should increase the productivity of software                        development for intelligent applications utilizing MIMD parallel                computers.//
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
